Text.Value: I act in the Weavemistress' name - I will not serve your wretched god.
The Dwarffather scoffs in the face of Bhaal. No.
Bhaal's slaughter has no place among Mielikki's wilds. I will do no such thing.
Adherents of the Spider Queen do not bend the knee to Bhaal.
Never - the Morninglord would never consort with one such as Bhaal.
I cannot serve two gods at once. Laduguer would not allow it.
Kelemvor has passed judgement on Bhaal - and found him wanting. I will not serve you.
Ilmater suffers for the sins of Bhaal - I would never serve him.
The Watcher has seen the manifest sins of your god. I will not join you.
Why would I serve your cowardly murder-god? I serve a god of war.
Serve Bhaal? I think Garl would find that most distasteful - no thank you.
Murder and dance do not make good bedfellows - on my Lady's behalf, I decline.
Slaughter's rather unfashionable these days. Besides, I'm celestially spoken for.
I serve no name but Bahamut's. And in his name I will strike you down.
Seems rather foolish - I don't think Lord Oghma would approve.
Sel√ªne's light rebukes you, fetid murderers. I will never join you.
I serve the Nightbringer, not some craven murder-lord.
I serve the noble Tempest - not your blasphemous murder-god.
There is no good to death without honour or purpose. I will not join you.
My slaughter is reserved for the Many Mawed Goddess, not Bhaal.
Tough luck - I already serve Tymora.
You think I'd spurn Lord Tyr for your pathetic, cowardly god? Laughable.
I bend the knee to the Lich Queen Vlaakith, no other.
I serve the Lady of Plenty - not a god of slaughter. Begone.
I serve no god but my own.
I claim you, little lamb - for Bhaal.
But you are not the lamb for our slaughter.
I will not slaughter innocents - I will protect them from you!
We redden our steel by the light of day in His name.
I will join your slaughter, but not in the name of Bhaal.
Join the attack.
You are our lamb, ready for slaughter.
Lady Orin asked us to test you, but I think you'll fail. What say you, little lamb?

EditorData.NodeContext: 'My boss told me to rub it in before I kill you'

Text.Value: Then you betray Orin, and Bhaal himself. Your blood will spill for this.
I serve no one but myself. I will not join you.
I serve my oath, not your Lord of Murder.
If you say so, little lamb. If you say so.
It seems you've won Lady Orin's favour. Join us, in this act of slaughter. In Bhaal's name.
I have better things to do, but you go ahead.

Synopsis: The player is confronted by some Bhaalist cutlists who've just murdered a civilian in Bloomridge park. The cultists recognise the player as even greater targets - those Orin wants dead. They turn hostile, with more appearing after the dialogue, leaving the player outnumbered.
